page.title: 15SOCIAL CONCERN, SPETCHLEY
page.content: {IRELAND Local churches have joined together together to welcome Irish children from troubled Belfast to this area to give them a holiday in peaceful countryside for a number of weeks. {ROADS The local cross-roads at Spetchley were altered recently to make them less dangerous, through the pressure put on the local council by the late Tommy Campden who was at first a 'link- length' man and then became a local councillor. {HISTORY Local people have been interested to contribute to this survey and have expressed concern for the interest of future generations in the {heritage}of this area .
